column1: Luninets was occupied by Nazi Germany from 10 July 1941 until 10 July 1944 and administered as a part of the Generalbezirk Wolhynien und Podolien of Reichskommissariat Ukraine. After 1944
column2: Luninets remained part of the Soviet Union until 1991
column3: at which time it became part of the newly independent Republic of Belarus.

column1: The Jewish population was important in the town. From 1941 to 1943
column2: 4 000 Jews were murdered in mass executions perpetrated by an Einsatzgruppe.
